short_term: Will likely continue to struggle with computer science and calculus courses, possibly seeking additional tutoring or support.
May consider changing major if current dissatisfaction persists.
long_term: Could potentially switch to a related but less technical major like Information Systems or Business with a tech focus.
If stays in Computer Science, might specialize in an area of interest found through exploration or internships.

short_term: Will focus on strengthening new friendships while also making efforts to reconnect with high school friends.
Might join campus clubs or groups to expand social network.
long_term: Will have established a solid group of friends and possibly a significant other.
Social circle will likely reflect personal growth, interests, and career aspirations.

short_term: Will seek mental health support through counseling services offered by the college.
Might start practicing mindfulness or relaxation techniques to manage stress.
long_term: Improved coping mechanisms for stress and potentially better mental health management.
Will likely develop a routine that balances academic work, social life, and personal time for well-being.

short_term: Will attempt to secure scholarships, grants, or part-time work to alleviate financial strain.
Might implement a stricter budget to manage NYC living costs.
long_term: Could become more financially independent through work experience or by securing financial aid.
Might consider moving to a less expensive area or finding roommates to reduce living expenses.

short_term: Will continue questioning the purpose of education, possibly leading to discussions with peers and mentors.
Might engage more deeply with philosophical texts or seek out philosophical societies on campus.
long_term: Could develop a personal philosophy or worldview that guides career and life choices.
Might become involved in educational reform or advocacy groups to address perceived issues in higher education.

short_term: Will likely face continued frustration with coding, prompting a search for more engaging projects or languages.

long_term: Could find a niche in coding that matches personal interest, leading to proficiency in that area.
